objects.name: Columbia Business School:Video as a Marketing Tool in Education
objects.description: Like many universities, Columbia Business School began using video to capture classes and make them available to students for later viewing. However, the school's marketing and communication departments soon realized the value in using video to promote the school's brand and feature some of its alumni. Chris Bellerjeau, Director of Multimedia Services at Columbia Business School, shares some statistics and explains how schools can measure ROI when in comes to video usage.
objects.tags: columbia, video platform, customizable, applications, video, education
objects.searchText: _PAR_ONLY_ _2076131_ _MEDIA_TYPE_1| Columbia Business School:Video as a Marketing Tool in Education columbia, video platform, customizable, applications, video, education Like many universities, Columbia Business School began using video to capture classes and make them available to students for later viewing. However, the schools marketing and communication departments soon realized the value in using video to promote the schools brand and feature some of its alumni. Chris Bellerjeau, Director of Multimedia Services at Columbia Business School, shares some statistics and explains how schools can measure ROI when in comes to video usage.

objects.name: Cornell Uni: Scaling the Video Infrastructure
objects.description: Michael Tolomeo, Instructional Media Manager, shares how video usage at Cornell University evolved over time. From transcoding all videos in-house to outsourcing it to Kaltura in order to scale quickly. Today, the integration with Blackboard Learn and Kaltura is so seamless that many faculty members are able to upload and share videos with no additional training.
objects.tags: instruction, media, video, production, centralized, plugin, learning management system, students, courses
objects.searchText: _PAR_ONLY_ _2076131_ _MEDIA_TYPE_1| Cornell Uni: Scaling the Video Infrastructure instruction, media, video, production, centralized, plugin, learning management system, students, courses Michael Tolomeo, Instructional Media Manager, shares how video usage at Cornell University evolved over time. From transcoding all videos in-house to outsourcing it to Kaltura in order to scale quickly. Today, the integration with Blackboard Learn and Kaltura is so seamless that many faculty members are able to upload and share videos with no additional training.

objects.name: Oregon State: Creating a Campus Media Portal
objects.description: Raul Burriel from Oregon State University discusses how OSU utilizes Kaltura's powerful Management Console (KMC) and easy to use MediaSpace front end (KMS), to give more than 25,000 users the ability to upload, transcode and deliver media in multiple formats for both desktop and tablet users. Working closely with Kaltura, OSU has brought its years of institutional knowledge and experience to media management.
objects.tags: education, video, campus, faculty, staff, students, sso, central, accessible, lecture capture

Working closely with Kaltura, OSU has brought its years of institutional knowledge and experience to media management.

objects.name: iCEV: Monetizing HQ EDU Videos on the Web
objects.description: Dusty Moore, President of iCEV, discusses how iCEV is using Kaltura to distribute educational videos. He explains the importance of producing quality content for the web and the advantage of having end-user analytics to help increase sales and ROI.
objects.tags: multimedia, library, cost effective, ease of use, content, devices, platforms, software, online, video

objects.name: SAP: Internal Social Video Portal in Enterprises
objects.description: In the past, it took days for SAP employees to create a single video. These days, it takes them an average of a few minutes. With over 80,000 employees, SAP uses Kaltura to distribute audio and video throughout the organization. Nina Kelley-Rumpff, Program Manager, Enterprise Collaboration, explains why video is a necessary tool for large enterprises and how to encourage employees to share videos across the company. Kelley-Rumpff also explains how to choose the video platform that is right for your organization.
objects.tags: enterprise, video, knowledge management, information, employee, sharing, media, training, how-to
